aou_req__feo__on_target_crates.content:
Only the following crates of the FEO module shall be used to build code that runs on
targets in release builds.

- feo
- feo-cpp-build
- feo-cpp-macros
- feo-time
aou_req__feo__on_target_crates.title: on_target_crates

aou_req__feo__rust_core_lib.content: The Rust core lib used to build FEO shall be qualified according to the same ASIL level as the FEO framework.
aou_req__feo__rust_core_lib.title: rust_core_lib

aou_req__feo__rust_std_lib_modules.content:
The following items from the Rust std library shall be safety qualified:

- std::collections::HashMap
- std::collections::HashSet
- std::fs::File
- std::fs::OpenOptions
- std::io::BufWriter
- std::io::Cursor
- std::io::Error
- std::io::Read
- std::io::Result
- std::io::Write
- std::net::TcpStream
- std::path::Path
- std::path::PathBuf
- std::sync::mpsc::bounded
- std::sync::mpsc::Receiver
- std::sync::mpsc::RecvTimeoutError
- std::sync::mpsc::SyncSender
- std::sync::OnceLock
- std::thread::JoinHandle
- std::thread::spawn
- std::time::Instant
- std::time::SystemTime
- std::time::UNIX_EPOCH
- std::vec::Vec

**Note:** The above list is not yet complete. It needs to be refined based on a final implementation.
At the moment, it covers probably about 95% of std library usages.
An accurate list could be determined by switching feo to #![no_std] and looking at the compilation errors,
but it gets quickly out of date with a changing codebase.
aou_req__feo__rust_std_lib_modules.title: rust_std_lib_modules

comp_req__feo__act_map_cfg.content: The mapping of activities to threads is done in the component configuration and cannot be changed at runtime.
comp_req__feo__act_map_cfg.title: Activity Mapping Configuration

comp_req__feo__activitiy_step.content:
Each Activity shall be stepped once within each execution of the Task Chain they belong to.
Stepping is done by a call to an activity's `step` function. The `step` function shall be invoked
in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activitiy_step.title: Stepping of Activities

comp_req__feo__activitiy_thread.content:
Each activity shall be mapped to one thread. The mapping cannot be changed at runtime.
Each activity's `init`, `step` and `shutdown` functions shall be executed in the assigned thread.
comp_req__feo__activitiy_thread.title: Mapping of Activities to threads

comp_req__feo__activity.content:
Each activitiy is mapped to exactly one thread within the primary or one of the secondary processes.
Each activity provides the following functions:

* `init`: Initialization of the activity.
* `step`: Execution of the activity.
* `shutdown`: Shutdown of the activity.
comp_req__feo__activity.title: Activity

comp_req__feo__activity_init.content:
Initialization of Activities shall be done during application initialization.

Each Activity shall be initialized by a call to its `init` function.
The `init` function shall be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activity_init.title: Initialization of Activities

comp_req__feo__activity_shutdown.content:
Shutdown of activities shall be done during application shutdown.

Each activity shall be shut down by a call to its `shutdown` function. The `shutdown` function shall be invoked
in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activity_shutdown.title: Shutdown of activities

comp_req__feo__agent.content:
In order to execute activities in secondary processes, the Scheduler shall use agents running in the secondary
processes. There shall be exactly one agent for each secondary process.

The Agent in a secondary process shall receive commands from the Scheduler, invoke actions on Activities within its
process and report back to the Scheduler. Each Activity that is part of the task chain in a secondary process shall
be associated with an Agent, which takes over the task to wait for a trigger from the Scheduler. When the Agent
gets a step request from the Scheduler, it calls the Step function of the Activity.
comp_req__feo__agent.title: Agent

comp_req__feo__alive_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
alive supervision checkpoint to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__alive_supervision.title: Alive supervision

comp_req__feo__application.content:
An application consists of one or more activities executed in one or multiple operating system processes.

In particular it consists of the primary process which handles the lifecycle, configuration and execution management.
It may optionally consist of one or more secondary processes.
The purpose of secondary processes is to run code in separate address spaces (Freedom From Interference) for safety reasons.
Each process (primary and secondary) belongs to exactly one application.
Each process contains one ore more operating system threads.
comp_req__feo__application.title: Application Processes

comp_req__feo__application_lifecycle.content: The Application Lifecycle shall consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.
comp_req__feo__application_lifecycle.title: Application Lifecycle Phases

comp_req__feo__comp_cfg.content:
The component shall provide a configuration mechanism that supports configuring

- the mapping of activities to threads
- the execution order of activities
- when the task chain is activated (e.g. a cycle time for cyclic execution)
comp_req__feo__comp_cfg.title: Component Configuration

comp_req__feo__comp_cfg_file.content: It shall be possible to define the component configuration in a pre-defined configuration file.
comp_req__feo__comp_cfg_file.title: Component Configuration from File

comp_req__feo__deadline_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
deadline supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__deadline_supervision.title: Support of deadline supervision checkpoints

comp_req__feo__logical_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
logical supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__logical_supervision.title: Support of logical supervision

comp_req__feo__scheduler.content: The component shall implement a scheduler (aka executor) that manages the execution of activities in correct order.
comp_req__feo__scheduler.title: Scheduler aka Executor

comp_req__feo__service_activity.content:
The component shall enable the implementation and execution of Service Activities, which are a means to interact
with the outside world, e.g. via network communication, direct sensor input or direct actuator output.

A Service Activity shall be enabled to use APIs external to the framework (e.g. networking APIs, reading from
external sensor devices, writing HW I/O, etc.)
comp_req__feo__service_activity.title: Service Activity

comp_req__feo__task_chain.content:
All activities within an application are arranged within a `Task Chain`.
There is exactly one task chain per application.

The task chain configuration defines the execution order of the activities.
In particular it defines when the task chain is activated (typically in a cyclic manner) and in which order the activities will run.

Every task chain may have one or multiple input service activities which will run in the beginning.
The purpose of an input service activity is to collect external input signals and provide them to the other activities during task chain execution.
Every task may have one or more output service activities which will run in the end.
The purpose of an output service activity is to collect signals produced by activities within the task chain and send them to external entities.
comp_req__feo__task_chain.title: Task Chain

comp_req__feo__trustable_computation.content:
The component shall provide mechanisms to check after the computation of
an Activity if the result is trustable.
This can be done e.g. via evaluation of floating point exceptions,
checking of hardware registers or status information of the
software platform.
comp_req__feo__trustable_computation.title: Trustable computation

doc__communication__proxy_skeleton.title: Communication through mw::com

feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.content:
Each activity is stepped once within each execution of the task chain they belong to.

Stepping is done by a call to an activity's `step` function.
feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.title: Stepping of activities

feat_req__feo__activity.content:
Activities are mapped to threads within primary or secondary processes.
Each activity is mapped to exactly one thread and provides the following functions:

* `init`: Initialization of the activity.
* `step`: Execution of the activity.
* `shutdown`: Shutdown of the activity.

The mapping is done in a configuration file and cannot be changed at runtime.
feat_req__feo__activity.title: Definition: Activity

feat_req__feo__activity_init.content:
Initialization of activities is done during application initialization.

Each activity is initialized by a call to its `init` function.

The `init` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
Note that `init`, `step` and `shutdown` functions will be run in the same thread.
feat_req__feo__activity_init.title: Initialization of activities

feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.content:
Shutdown of activities is done during application shutdown.

Each activity is shut down by a call to its `shutdown` function.

The `shutdown` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.title: Shutdown of activities

feat_req__feo__agent.content:
In order to execute activities in secondary processes, the executor makes
use of an `Agent` for each secondary process and possibly also the primary process.
The agent receives commands from the executor, invokes actions on
activities within its process and reports back to the executor.

Each Activity that is part of the task chain is associated with an
Agent, which takes over the task to wait for a trigger from its
corresponding Executor. When the Agent gets a step request from the
Executor, it calls the Step function of the Activity There is exactly
one agent for each secondary process. The primary can but doesn't have to be
associated with an agent.
feat_req__feo__agent.title: Definition: Agent

feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
alive supervision checkpoint to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.title: Alive supervision

An application consists of one or more operating system processes.
In particular it consists of the primary process which handles the lifecycle, configuration and execution management.
It may optionally consist of one or more secondary processes.
The purpose of secondary processes is to run code in separate address spaces (Freedom From Interference) for safety reasons.
Each process (primary and secondary) belongs to exactly one application.
Each process contains one ore more operating system threads.
feat_req__feo__application.title: Definition: Application

feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.content: The Application Lifecycle consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.
feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.title: The lifecycle of an `Application` consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.

feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
deadline supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.title: Support of deadline supervision checkpoints

feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
logical supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.title: Support of logical supervision

  (e.g. networking APIs, reading from external sensor devices, writing HW I/O, etc.)

feat_req__ipc__acl_for_consumer.content:
The communication framework shall support an Access Control List for the communication partner consuming a service
instance.
An entry in the ACL corresponds to an allowed producer.
feat_req__ipc__acl_for_consumer.title: Access Control List for consumer

feat_req__ipc__acl_for_producer.content:
The communication framework shall support an Access Control List for the communication partner offering a service
instance (producer).
An entry in the ACL corresponds to an allowed consumer.
feat_req__ipc__acl_for_producer.title: Access Control List for producer

feat_req__ipc__acl_per_service_instance.content: The communication framework shall support an Access Control List per service instance.
feat_req__ipc__acl_per_service_instance.title: Access Control List per service instance

feat_req__ipc__acl_placement.content: The communication framework shall support an Access Control Lists in the deployment configuration.
feat_req__ipc__acl_placement.title: Access Control List Placement

feat_req__ipc__asil.content: The communication framework shall support safe communication up to ASIL-B.
feat_req__ipc__asil.title: IPC ASIL level

feat_req__ipc__availability.content:
The IPC binding shall ensure availability of its communication, so that the availability is independent per
criticality level.
feat_req__ipc__availability.title: IPC Availability

feat_req__ipc__binding_agnostic_api.content:
The public API of the communication framework shall be binding-agnostic.

Note:
Binding-agnostic in this context means, that the public API is independent of the binding underneath. E.g., if the
binding is exchanged, the public API remains syntactically and semantically unchanged.
feat_req__ipc__binding_agnostic_api.title: Binding-agnostic public API

feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.content: The IPC binding shall ensure confidentiality of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.title: IPC Confidentiality

feat_req__ipc__data_corruption.content: Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to corrupt data consumed by partners with higher criticality.
feat_req__ipc__data_corruption.title: Data Corruption

feat_req__ipc__data_driven_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a data-driven architecture.
feat_req__ipc__data_driven_arch.title: Support for Data-driven Architecture

feat_req__ipc__data_loss.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to drop data before it is consumed by partners with higher
criticality.
feat_req__ipc__data_loss.title: Data Loss

feat_req__ipc__data_reordering.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to modify the order of data consumed by partners with higher
criticality.
feat_req__ipc__data_reordering.title: Data Reordering

feat_req__ipc__data_repetition.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to duplicate data consumed by other communication partners with
higher criticality.
feat_req__ipc__data_repetition.title: Data Repetition

feat_req__ipc__depl_config_runtime.content: Deployment configuration shall be read from an integrity-checked configuration file at runtime.
feat_req__ipc__depl_config_runtime.title: Deployment configuration at runtime

feat_req__ipc__event_type.content:
An event-type is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name
- a data type

The producer can assign a value to it.
Consumers can subscribe to value-changed events of the element or poll unseen, cached events.
feat_req__ipc__event_type.title: Event Type

feat_req__ipc__integrity.content: The IPC binding shall ensure integrity of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__integrity.title: IPC Integrity

feat_req__ipc__interfaces.content:
A communication interface consists of a combination of any number of the following elements:

- Event-Types
- Methods
- Signals
feat_req__ipc__interfaces.title: Communication Interfaces

feat_req__ipc__lang_idioms.content: Each public API shall support the idioms of the programming language it is written in.
feat_req__ipc__lang_idioms.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__ipc__lang_idioms.title: Support for programming language idioms

feat_req__ipc__lang_infra.content:
Each public API shall use core infrastructure of its programming language and accompanying standard libraries,
whenever possible and meaningful.

Note: This includes error handling.
feat_req__ipc__lang_infra.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__ipc__lang_infra.title: Use programming language infrastructure

feat_req__ipc__method.content:
A method is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name
- a specified application routine with a given set of parameters and a return type

When a communication partner issues a call to the method with the required parameters:

1. it shall invoke the application routine with the provided parameters, and
2. return its result to the communication partner

A method call shall be possible both synchronously and asynchronously.
feat_req__ipc__method.title: Method

feat_req__ipc__multi_binding_depl.content: The association of a service instance and the appropriate binding shall be specified in the deployment configuration.
feat_req__ipc__multi_binding_depl.title: Multi-binding deployment configuration

feat_req__ipc__multi_binding_support.content:
The communication framework shall support multiple bindings.

Note:
A binding performs the conversion of user communication to the respective communication protocol.
It does this either directly or via a gateway approach.
feat_req__ipc__multi_binding_support.title: Multi-binding support

feat_req__ipc__multi_lang.content: The communication framework shall provide a public API for each supported programming language of S-CORE.
feat_req__ipc__multi_lang.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__ipc__multi_lang.title: Support for multiple programming languages

feat_req__ipc__producer_consumer.content: Communication shall be cached based on the producer-consumer pattern.
feat_req__ipc__producer_consumer.title: Producer-Consumer Pattern

feat_req__ipc__request_driven_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a request-driven architecture.
feat_req__ipc__request_driven_arch.title: Support for Request-driven Architecture

feat_req__ipc__safe_communication.content:
The communication framework shall support safe communication involving communication partners on the same or multiple
criticality levels.
feat_req__ipc__safe_communication.title: Safe communication over criticality levels

feat_req__ipc__service_discovery.content:
The communication framework shall provide service discovery to find available services during runtime.
Service discovery shall consider version compatibility.
Service discovery shall be handled implicitly (where possible).
Note: The service discovery may be restricted/impacted by availability of deployment information.
feat_req__ipc__service_discovery.title: Service discovery

feat_req__ipc__service_instance.content:
A communication interface that is offered to consumers is called a service instance.

Multiple service instances shall be able to offer the same interface.
feat_req__ipc__service_instance.title: Service Instance

feat_req__ipc__service_instance_granular.content:
The communication framework shall support multiple service instances per software architecture element.
Note: A software architecture element is for example an application, activity, proces, ...
feat_req__ipc__service_instance_granular.title: Service instance_granularity

feat_req__ipc__service_instance_names.content:
A service instance is offered under one or more unique names by which it can be discovered.
Names follow a POSIX path style.

Note: The resolution from a service instance name to the protocol-specific identifier is handled by the service
discovery.
feat_req__ipc__service_instance_names.title: Service Instance Names

feat_req__ipc__service_location_transpar.content:
The interface to access service instances is agnostic to the binding used to communicate with the service.
Note: Deployment information may require manual changes based on where the service is located.
feat_req__ipc__service_location_transpar.title: Service location transparency

feat_req__ipc__signal.content:
A signal is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name

A client can trigger the signal.
The service instance offering the trigger can:

- wait for the signal to be triggered
- check if the signal was triggered

Note: Signals can not transport data. They are meant to be fast synchronization mechanism with low setup cost.
Thus, depending on the location of the communication partners primitives like Linux Signals or QNX Pulses or
Hypervisor Signalling APIs may be chosen.
feat_req__ipc__signal.title: Signal

feat_req__ipc__stateless_communication.content:
The communication framework shall support stateless communication.
Note:
- In case of events, the producer is not aware of its consumers.
- In case of RPC, the skeleton is not aware of the proxy, this request originated from.
feat_req__ipc__stateless_communication.title: Stateless communication

feat_req__ipc__testability_fake_binding.content: The communication framework shall provide a fake binding.
feat_req__ipc__testability_fake_binding.section_name: Full testability for the user facing API
sections: Full testability for the user facing API
feat_req__ipc__testability_fake_binding.title: Fake binding

feat_req__ipc__testability_mock_api.content: The public API shall be fully mockable.
feat_req__ipc__testability_mock_api.section_name: Full testability for the user facing API
sections: Full testability for the user facing API
feat_req__ipc__testability_mock_api.title: Fully mockable public API

feat_req__ipc__time_based_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a time-based architecture.
feat_req__ipc__time_based_arch.title: Support for Time-based Architecture

feat_req__ipc__tracing.content:
The communication framework shall provide infrastructure to enable binding-agnostic, zero-copy, read-only tracing of
communication.
feat_req__ipc__tracing.title: Support for Tracing

feat_req__ipc__versioning.content:
The communication framework shall support versioning of service instances.
Version information of a service instance is binding-specific.
Version information is provided in the deployment configuration.

Note:
Multiple service instances can have the same interface and version.
feat_req__ipc__versioning.title: Versioning

feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.content: IPC communication shall be possible without copying to-be-transferred data.
feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.title: Zero-Copy IPC

feat_req__kvs__access_control.content: The KVS shall ensure that only authorized components can access individual data stores.
feat_req__kvs__access_control.title: Separate data stores

feat_req__kvs__async_api.content: The KVS shall provide an asynchronous API for accessing and manipulating data.
feat_req__kvs__async_api.title: Provide an async API

feat_req__kvs__config_file.content: The KVS shall support the configuration of memory and other resource limits via a configuration file.
feat_req__kvs__config_file.title: Configure limits via file

feat_req__kvs__cpp_rust_interoperability.content: The KVS system shall provide access through both C++ and Rust interfaces.
feat_req__kvs__cpp_rust_interoperability.title: C++ & Rust Interoperability

feat_req__kvs__default_value_file.content: The KVS shall support the configuration of default key values using an external file.
feat_req__kvs__default_value_file.title: Set default key values via file

feat_req__kvs__default_value_reset.content: The KVS system shall support resetting a single key or all keys to their respective default values.
feat_req__kvs__default_value_reset.title: Default Value Reset

feat_req__kvs__default_value_retrieval.content: The KVS system shall support retrieving the default value associated with a key.
feat_req__kvs__default_value_retrieval.title: Default Value Retrieval

feat_req__kvs__default_values.content: The KVS system shall support predefined default values for keys.
feat_req__kvs__default_values.title: Default Values

feat_req__kvs__dev_mode.content:
The KVS shall provide both engineering (developer) and field modes.
The engineering mode shall allow unrestricted data access.
feat_req__kvs__dev_mode.title: Support engineering and field mode

feat_req__kvs__events.content:
The KVS shall provide an API that allows for the registration of callback
functions. These callbacks shall be invoked in response to specific events,
such as when keys are changed or removed.
feat_req__kvs__events.title: Data-change events

feat_req__kvs__fast_access.content: The KVS shall ensure that key operations are typically completed within 5 milliseconds.
feat_req__kvs__fast_access.title: Fast access

feat_req__kvs__integrity_check.content:
The KVS system shall detect and report data corruption.
Note: Implementation depends on AoUs.
feat_req__kvs__integrity_check.title: Integrity Check

feat_req__kvs__intra_process_comm.content: The KVS shall support concurrent intra-process data access.
feat_req__kvs__intra_process_comm.title: Intra-Process Data Access

feat_req__kvs__maximum_size.content: The KVS system shall support specification of its maximum capacity at compile time.
feat_req__kvs__maximum_size.title: Maximum Size

feat_req__kvs__multiple_kvs.content: The KVS system shall allow instantiating multiple independent stores per software architecture element.
feat_req__kvs__multiple_kvs.title: Multiple KVS per Software Architecture Element

feat_req__kvs__persist_data.content: The KVS shall support storing and loading its data to and from persistent storage.
feat_req__kvs__persist_data.title: Store persistent data

feat_req__kvs__persistency.content: The KVS system shall persist stored data and provide an API to explicitly trigger persistence.
feat_req__kvs__persistency.title: Persistency

feat_req__kvs__snapshots.content:
The KVS system shall support explicit creation of snapshots identified by unique IDs and allow rollback to previous snapshots.
Snapshots shall also be deletable.
feat_req__kvs__snapshots.title: Snapshots

feat_req__kvs__stable_api.content: The KVS API shall remain stable throughout its lifecycle while enabling the addition of new functionalities.
feat_req__kvs__stable_api.title: Stable APIs

feat_req__kvs__supported_datatypes_keys.content: The KVS system shall support UTF-8 encoded strings as valid key types.
feat_req__kvs__supported_datatypes_keys.title: Supported Datatypes (Keys)

feat_req__kvs__supported_datatypes_value.content:
The KVS system shall support storing both primitive and non-primitive datatypes as values.
The supported datatypes shall match those used by the IPC feature.
feat_req__kvs__supported_datatypes_value.title: Supported Datatypes (Values)

feat_req__kvs__tooling.content: The KVS system shall provide tooling support for viewing and modifying key-value pairs during development and debugging.
feat_req__kvs__tooling.title: Tooling

feat_req__kvs__update_mechanism.content: The KVS system shall implement mechanisms to upgrade from one version to another, including multi-version jumps.
feat_req__kvs__update_mechanism.title: Update Mechanism

feat_req__kvs__variant_management.content: The KVS shall ensure compatibility across different architectures and versions.
feat_req__kvs__variant_management.title: Variant management support

feat_req__kvs__versioning.content: The KVS system shall support versioning for different layout configurations.
feat_req__kvs__versioning.title: Versioning

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_dat.content: The platform shall support an event-driven, high-throughput application architecture where execution is triggered by data changes.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_dat.title: Support for Data-driven Architecture

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_req.content: The platform shall support a request-driven, asynchronous application architecture that processes requests on-demand.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_req.title: Support for Request-driven Architecture

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_tim.content:
The platform shall support a deterministic, time-based application execution model that triggers logic based on predefined schedules or
polling intervals.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_tim.title: Support for Time-based Architectures

stkh_req__communication__auto_diagnostic.content:
The following diagnostic protocols shall be supported
* UDS (ISO14229) Diagnostics
* Diagnostic trouble codes
* Diagnostic jobs
stkh_req__communication__auto_diagnostic.title: Automotive diagnostics

stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.content: The platform shall support external communication via well established protocols e.g. Zenoh, DDS.
stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.rationale: ECUs need to interact with each other. There are multiple protocols today and more to come in the future.
stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.title: Extensible External Communication

stkh_req__communication__inter_process.content: The platform shall support inter-process communication.
stkh_req__communication__inter_process.rationale: Application software typically consists of multiple processes which need to interact.
stkh_req__communication__inter_process.title: Inter-process Communication

stkh_req__communication__intra_process.content: The platform shall support intra-process communication.
stkh_req__communication__intra_process.rationale: Application software typically maps software building blocks into the same process.
stkh_req__communication__intra_process.title: Intra-process Communication

stkh_req__communication__safe.content: The platform shall support safe communication.
stkh_req__communication__safe.rationale: Distributed safe systems often require communication to be safe.
stkh_req__communication__safe.title: Safe Communication

stkh_req__communication__secure.content: The platform shall support secure communication.
stkh_req__communication__secure.rationale: Distributed secure systems often require secure communication.
stkh_req__communication__secure.title: Secure Communication

stkh_req__communication__service_quality.content:
The software platform shall provide a framework to ensure quality of service
of applications deployed on the platform. This includes but is not limited
to:

* QOS for applications
* Controlled latency for communication and scheduling
* Guaranteed network and compute quotas
stkh_req__communication__service_quality.title: Quality of service

stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.content:
The platform shall provide a framework to mitigate incompatible changes on
external interfaces to keep application interfaces stable.
stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.rationale: In case of incompatible changes on external interface the portability effort shall be reduced.
stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.title: Stable application interfaces

stkh_req__communication__supported_net.content:
The software platform shall support the following automotive network
protocols

* SOME/IP
* DDS
* UWB including Driver for UWB Peripheral
* SPI (+ CSC ADI & Texas Instruments chipset support)
* Vehicle to Grid + ISO Charge protocols
* AVB
stkh_req__communication__supported_net.title: Supported network protocols

stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.content:
The software platform shall support applications with an automotive safety
integrity level up to ASIL-B.

Note: This is part of 0.1 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.rationale: The platform shall be usable by safety relevant applications.
stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.title: Automotive Safety Integrity Level

stkh_req__dependability__availability.content:
The software platform shall support the development of highly available systems.
(see also `Availability <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Availability>`_).
stkh_req__dependability__availability.title: Availability

stkh_req__dependability__safety_features.content:
The following safety feature shall be supported by the software platform:

* Health Management (alive, deadline, logical supervision) for time and event based taskchains
* E2E Protection for communication
* Built-in hardware self-tests
* Safe reset paths
* IO MMU protecting DMA accesses
* Memory Management Unit
* Memory Protection Unit for caches
* ECC Memory
* Software Lockstep
* Power management integrated circuit (PMIC), external watchdog and voltage monitoring
* Safe switch from engineering for field mode and back
stkh_req__dependability__safety_features.title: Safety features

stkh_req__dependability__security_featur.content:
The following security features shall be supported by the platform

* Mandatory access control
* Secure boot
* Secure onboard communication
* IPSec and MACSec
* Firewall
* Certificate installation and storage in HSM or ARM trustzone.
* Kernel hardening (ASLR, Pointer obfuscation …) in libc and compiler
* Identity and Access Management
* Secure Feature Activation
* Secure software update
stkh_req__dependability__security_featur.title: Security features

stkh_req__dev_experience__boot_logging.content:
The platform shall support logging of data to memory which survives a reboot
cycle.
stkh_req__dev_experience__boot_logging.title: Previous boot logging

stkh_req__dev_experience__debugging.content:
The software platform shall provide a method and interface to enable
debugging of the software on target and in vehicle.
stkh_req__dev_experience__debugging.title: Debugging

stkh_req__dev_experience__dev_toolchain.content:
The platform shall support a state-of-the art developer experience for
functional development and application development.

Features:

* IDE support for all supported languages.
* IDL Editor with syntax highlighting.
* Connection to qemu and real target via SSH.
* Support of continuous integration and deployment systems.
stkh_req__dev_experience__dev_toolchain.title: Developer experience and development toolchain

stkh_req__dev_experience__idl_support.content:
The platform shall provide a human readable interface definition language
with decentralized glue code generation.
stkh_req__dev_experience__idl_support.title: IDL Support

stkh_req__dev_experience__logging_suppor.content:
The platform shall support the following logging setups:

* Logging to external disk via mounted filesystem on top of PCIe driver
* Logging via second dedicated Ethernet Channel
* Logging/sensor data Gathering via Cloud native filesystem on top of second Ethernet Channel
* Gathering of raw sensor data e.g. video streams
* Diagnostic Log and Trace / Logcat format is supported
* Logging of early startup events
stkh_req__dev_experience__logging_suppor.title: Logging support

stkh_req__dev_experience__perf_analysis.content:
The software platform shall support performance analysis of platform and
application software:

* Flame-graph visualization for long termed CPU behavior
* RAM usage statistics for long-term Memory behavior
stkh_req__dev_experience__perf_analysis.title: Performance analysis

stkh_req__dev_experience__prog_languages.content:
The platform shall support implementation of applications in the following
programming languages up to the highest ASIL level as defined in :need:`stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safety`:

* C
* C++
* Rust
stkh_req__dev_experience__prog_languages.title: Programming languages for application development

stkh_req__dev_experience__reprocessing.content: The platform shall support data-collection and injection of reprocessed data.
stkh_req__dev_experience__reprocessing.title: Reprocessing and simulation support

stkh_req__dev_experience__timing_analysi.content:
The software platform shall support observation, assessment of
timing requirements with state-of-the-art analysis tools.
stkh_req__dev_experience__timing_analysi.title: Timing analysis

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_com.content:
The platform shall support the tracing of communication events for internal
and external communication systems.
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_com.title: Tracing of communication

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_exe.content:
The platform shall support the tracing of events (start, stop) of executable
entities and kernel threads on all computation units e.g.

* CPU
* GPU
* Neural Network Processors
* Image Processors
* etc.
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_exe.title: Tracing of execution

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_mem.content:
The platform shall support the tracing of memory events (allocation, copy,
de-allocation) for different types of memory e.g.

* CPU Memory
* GPU Memory
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_mem.title: Tracing of memory access

stkh_req__execution_model__low_power.content: The software platform shall support low power modes to safe energy.
stkh_req__execution_model__low_power.title: Low power mode

stkh_req__execution_model__processes.content:
The platform shall support the following scheduling strategies:

* Process Management

  * Startup and Shutdown of processes
  * Recovery
  * Machine State Management (modelled via simple JSON file)

* Cross-process synchronization of threads (Activities)

  * Event activated multi-process taskchains
  * Time-sliced activated multi-process taskchains
  * memory management (via PMR),
  * signal handling, error handling (FPU Exceptions, other traps …)
stkh_req__execution_model__processes.title: Processes and thread management

stkh_req__execution_model__realtime_cap.content:
The platform shall support the controlled reaction on events
(timing events, interrupts) within a defined timing interval.
stkh_req__execution_model__realtime_cap.title: Realtime capabilities

stkh_req__execution_model__short_app_cyc.content:
Cycle times of less then 5 ms on application level shall by supported by the
platform assumed this is supported by the underlying hardware.
stkh_req__execution_model__short_app_cyc.title: Short application cycles

stkh_req__execution_model__startup_perf.content:
The software platform shall support fast startup scenarios e.g. cold boot and
resume from hibernate mode.
stkh_req__execution_model__startup_perf.title: Startup performance

stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.content:
The software platform shall provide towards the applications a safe
(ISO26262-2018) key/value store.

Note: This is part of 0.1 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.rationale: Key/Value storage is a standard way to structure file based non-volatile memory access.
stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.title: Support of safe Key/Value store

stkh_req__functional_req__comm_with_cont.content:
The software platform shall define protocols and concepts for the interaction with
external micro-controllers for

* board management
* external supervision for safety and security functions
* software update
* debugging
* feature activation
stkh_req__functional_req__comm_with_cont.title: Communication with external MCUs/standby controllers

stkh_req__functional_req__comp_subsystem.content:
The compute subsystem shall provide the following frameworks towards the
applications:

* Math library: Eigen Blaze like safety enhanced math front-end library
* Graphics and compute API: Vulkan GPU back-end and CPU (SIMD capable)-based compute libraries:

  * Deep Neural Network API:  (including pytorch, tensorflow conversion scripts)
  * Computer Vision API: e.g. like OpenCV
  * Linear algebra API: e.g. BLAS / Lapack
  * AVB Sensor streams
  * PCIe Sensor streams
  * Shared Memory Sensor streams
  * GSML serialized data
stkh_req__functional_req__comp_subsystem.title: Compute subsystem

stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.content: The platform shall support to store data on non-volatile memory e.g. disks, flash, etc.
stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.rationale: Applications typically need to store data across power cycles.
stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.title: Data Persistency

stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.content: The platform shall support configuration of applications via files (e.g. yaml, json)
stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.rationale: File based configuration allows changes without rebuilding the software.
stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.title: File Based Configuration

stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.content: The platform shall support computation accelerated by a Hardware accelerator.
stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.rationale: High computation loads typically need to be speed up hardware acceleration e.g. in ADAS applications
stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.title: Hardware Accelerated Computation

stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.content: The platform shall support operating systems compliant with IEEE Std 1003.1 (2004 Edition or newer)
stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.rationale: This allows portability of platform on POSIX compliant operating systems.
stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.title: Operating System

stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.content: The platform shall support safe computation.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.rationale: Safe systems require computations to be done in safe environments.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.title: Safe Computation

stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.content:
The platform shall support safe configuration.
Note: This is part of 0.1 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.rationale: Configuration files may hold safety relevant information.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.title: Safe Configuration

stkh_req__functional_req__video_subsyste.content:
The software platform shall provide an interface for pre-processing and
distribution of camera data via the following mechanisms

* PCIe Graphic streams
* Shared Memory Graphic streams
* Display Serial Interface Driver
* APIX serialization driver
* ISP Driver including correction and frame pre-processing CV library (lens distortion et. al.)
* Sensor Streamer component (binding ISP Driver & pre-processing CV library)
stkh_req__functional_req__video_subsyste.title: Video subsystem

stkh_req__hardware_support__chipset_supp.content: The platform shall support arm64 and x64 architectures.
stkh_req__hardware_support__chipset_supp.title: Chipset support for ARM64 and x64

stkh_req__hardware_support__container_te.content:
The software platform shall support deployment of self-contained application
bundles

* Kernel Features: e.g. cgroup, secpol, namespaces as precondition for containerization
* e.g. SOAFFEE Like realtime capable containers: https://www.soafee.io/
stkh_req__hardware_support__container_te.title: Support of container technologies

stkh_req__hardware_support__debug_and_te.content:
The software platform shall run on qemu to enable test and debug in virtualized
environments.
stkh_req__hardware_support__debug_and_te.title: Virtualization support for debug and testing

stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.content: Integration of multiple repositories shall be supported in a unified workflow.
stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.rationale: Allow independent development of software modules
stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.title: Multirepo integration

stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.content: The software platform shall where possible be based on existing standards (e.g. network protocols).
stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.rationale: To enable cooperation with other cooperation partners.
stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.title: Enable cooperation via standardized APIs

stkh_req__overall_goals__ip_protection.content:
The software platform shall support cooperation models, where partners do not
want to disclose their intellectual property of applications to all other
partners.
stkh_req__overall_goals__ip_protection.title: IP protection

stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.content:
The platform shall enable the reuse of application software via a set of managed APIs.
These APIs shall be developed via a well-defined life-cycle ensuring
non-breaking changes.
stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long maintenance support
stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.title: Reuse of application software via managed APIs

stkh_req__overall_goals__variant_managem.content:
The software platform shall provide variant management support.
Variant management support shall enable users to ensure the
compatibility of application software across vehicle variants and vehicle
software releases.
stkh_req__overall_goals__variant_managem.title: Variant management

stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.content: All assumptions and design decisions made shall be specified as requirements and agreed within the S-CORE community.
stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long term maintenance support
stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.title: Document assumptions and design decisions

stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.content: All requirements shall be linked from lower to upper level, whereby the top-level are the stakeholder requirements.
stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long term maintenance support
stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.title: Requirements traceability

stkh_req__requirements__as_code.content: Requirements shall be documented as code (Docs-as-code).
stkh_req__requirements__as_code.rationale: In this project no external tool or service is used. Therefore as-code is the selected option.
stkh_req__requirements__as_code.title: Document requirements as code

tool_req__tool__bazel_build.content: Bazel shall be used for building, testing and integrating software.
tool_req__tool__bazel_build.title: Bazel for unified build, test and integration

tool_req__tool__sphinx_needs_process.content: Spinx-needs shall be used to model all processes within S-CORE.
tool_req__tool__sphinx_needs_process.title: Sphinx-needs for process modelling

wp__tailoring_platform.content:
This work product instantiation links to all the work products which are tailored out in the platform safety plan,
to be able to demonstrate completeness in `REPLACE external_standards`, and this is a document, not work product
wp__tailoring_platform.title: Tailoring Document Platform

arch.description: Mapping of uml key to uml content.

constraints.description: List of constraint names, which are defined for this need.

constraints_error.description: An error message set if any constraint failed, and `error_message` field is set in config.

constraints_passed.description: True if all constraints passed, False if any failed, None if not yet checked.

constraints_results.description: Mapping of constraint name, to check name, to result.

docname.description: Name of the document where the need is defined (None if external).

doctype.description: Type of the document where the need is defined, e.g. '.rst'.

external_css.description: CSS class name, added to the external reference.

external_url.description: URL of the need, if it is an external need.

has_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list.

has_forbidden_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list, and the link type does not allow dead links.

is_external.description: If true, no node is created and need is referencing external url.

is_modified.description: Whether the need was modified by needextend.

is_need.description: Whether the need is a need.

is_part.description: Whether the need is a part.

jinja_content.description: Whether the content should be pre-processed by jinja.

layout.description: Key of the layout, which is used to render the need.

lineno.description: Line number where the need is defined (None if external).

parts.description: Mapping of parts, a.k.a. sub-needs, IDs to data that overrides the need's data

signature.description: Derived from a docutils desc_name node.

style.description: Comma-separated list of CSS classes (all appended by `needs_style_`).
